title: Shares of automaker & auto component companies are trading lower amid market weakness as investors await today's Federal Reserve decision and update on the state of the economy. Markets have sold off over the past few sessions following recent surge.

Shares of several companies in the broader consumer discretionary space are trading higher as markets continue to gain on optimism over an economic reopening as well as a smaller-than-expected drop in nonfarm payrolls. The economy reopening could mean more consumer spending which is good for the sector.

Shares of several consumer discretionary companies are trading higher as equities gain amid continued optimism towards a rebound in economic activity, which could lead to a potential rebound in spending.
